wikipedia_page.main: Hilary Byfield Stratton FRBS  (29 June 1906 – 20 May 1985) was an English sculptor, stonemason and teacher working in the 20th Century. He is best known for his stone carvings and memorials but experimented in other media that included: perspex, copper and resin. Stratton was an adherent of Eric Gill, with whom he was apprenticed at the age of thirteen, whilst the influence of the Arts and Crafts movement was evident in much of Stratton's work.
